Package org.wmn4j.analysis.harmony

Class Chromagram

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wmn4j.analysis.harmony.Chromagram
  • public final class Chromagram
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a chromagram (i.e. pitch class profile) in twelve-tone equal-temperament (TET). A chromagram is a 12-dimensional vector that has a non-negative value associated with each pitch class. Chromagrams can be used for characterising harmony.

    This class is immutable.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static Chromagram of​(java.util.Map<PitchClass,​java.lang.Double> profile)
        Returns a chromagram with the given mapping of pitch classes to non-negative values. If a pitch class is not present in the mapping, then the value of that pitch class defaults to zero.
        Parameters:
        profile - the values for the pitch classes
        Returns:
        a chromagram with the given mapping of pitch classes to values

      • getValue

        public double getValue​(PitchClass pc)
        Returns the value associated with the given pitch class.
        Parameters:
        pc - pitch class for which the value is returned
        Returns:
        the value associated with the given pitch class

      • correlation

        public double correlation​(Chromagram other)
        Returns the correlation between this and the given chromagram. Uses Pearson correlation coefficient formula for a sample. Normalizing the profiles does not affect correlation.
        Parameters:
        other - the chromagram with which the correlation is returned
        Returns:
        the correlation between this and the given chromagram
